intro: Bignonia antisyphilitica, commonly known as the yellow glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-yellow tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves and produces long, pendulous racemes of blooms. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in woodland edges and along stream banks. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
